intro: Ixora gleasonii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ixora, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Ixora gleasonii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy plant in tropical and subtropical climates.
